==Chinese==
{{zh-forms|type=12}}
{{wikipedia|Melbourne}}

===Etymology===
The name refers to the [[gold rush]] around Melbourne and contrasts it with {{zh-l|舊金山|Old Gold Mountain}}: [[San Francisco]], [[California]], in the [[United States]]. ({{zh-l|金山}} being used loosely for any place of great chances for wealth, in a similar fashion to the English "[[gold mine]]".)
